actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

official_title: A bill to require the Secretary of Energy to provide loans and grants for solar installations in low-income and underserved areas.

summary.text:
Low-Income Solar Act

This bill requires the Department of Energy (DOE) to establish a loan and grant program for photovoltaic solar installations in low-income and underserved areas for FY2016-FY2030.

Loans must be provided to eligible entities for: (1) community solar facilities that reserve at least 25% of the electricity generated by the facility for low-income households, or (2) solar installations at federally subsidized affordable housing at multi-family complexes.

A community solar facility may use a loan under the program only to offset the costs of generation and provision of solar energy to low-income households that are subscribers of the facility.

Grants must be given to eligible, low-income households to: (1) pay the upfront costs of solar electricity generating facilities; or (2) pay for the development of new solar projects, including the costs of solar equipment and installation as well as the cost of job training associated with solar projects.
